title: What’s Happening in Space Policy March 10-16, 2024
summary: Here is SpacePolicyOnline.com’s list of space policy events for the week of March 10-16, 2024 and any insight we can offer about them. The House and Senate are in session […]

title: Stratolaunch performs first powered Talon flight
summary: Stratolaunch conducted the first powered flight of its Talon vehicle March 9, reaching “high supersonic” speeds in the uncrewed test.

title: Ursa Major’s Hadley rocket engine flies for the first time
summary: The engine powered the first flight of Stratolaunch's Talon-A1 hypersonic test vehicle

title: Juno measures oxygen production on Europa
summary: Using NASA’s Juno spacecraft, scientists have calculated the rate of oxygen production on Jupiter’s moon Europa — the first time any spacecraft had directly measured charged oxygen and hydrogen particles from the moon’s atmosphere. From these measurements, the team determined the rate of oxygen production to be much lower than estimated in previous studies.

title: Congress passes final fiscal year 2024 spending bill for NASA, NOAA and FAA
summary: Congress has passed a final fiscal year 2024 spending bill that provides, in some cases, significantly less funding than requested for civil space programs.

title: BlackSky secures back-to-back U.S. Air Force contracts
summary: The company won a $3.5 million award under a four-year contract worth up to $23 million for satellite imagery and data analytics to enable space-based tracking of moving vehicles

title: The Exploration Company’s Mission Possible Demo Flight Slips to 2025
summary:
The Exploration Company has announced that its Mission Possible demonstration flight will not occur in 2024 as previously expected.

In an interview with Bloomberg on...

title: ISS schedule conflicts delay Starliner crewed test flight to May
summary: The first crewed flight of Boeing’s CST-100 Starliner has slipped from late April to early May because of International Space Station schedule conflicts and not due to any issues with the spacecraft itself.

title: Space One scrubs Japan’s first commercial orbital launch
summary: Space One is planning Japan’s first private-sector orbital launch with the debut of its small satellite launcher — this will also be the maiden flight from a new, dedicated, launch facility.

title: China targets 2030 for Mars sample return mission, potential landing areas revealed
summary: China is making progress towards a 2030 launch for its Tianwen-3 Mars sample return mission and has narrowed down potential landing areas.
